title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: premiership-winning backs coach alex king leaves northampton saints .
hospital parking charge one of the highest in england .
northants ben duckett chance to impress in bangladesh washed out .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: we 'll be back on monday morning with all the news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
all that remains is to wish best of luck to northampton 's lesley joseph tomorrow in strictly come dancing , but also happy birthday as the birds of feather actress is 71 today .
let 's hope it 's one to remember .

documents.title: weather : rain around , but also sunny spells
text: tonight will be rather cloudy with outbreaks of patchy rain spreading across eastern parts of the region .
staying drier across the west , with lows around 9-11c ( 48-52f ) .
tomorrow there may be a few light showers at first , but otherwise it will be a largely dry day with sunny spells - especially during the early afternoon .
highs of around 16-17c ( 61-63f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: repair work on viaduct to put in second corby to kettering line
text: i 've been with engineers at network rail as they work on putting in a second line between kettering and corby .
the line is due to open on 24 october and requires several bridges and viaducts to be repaired and strengthened , including the harpers brook viaduct where i have been
you can see more tonight on bbc look east , on bbc one at 18:30 .
repairing 1879 viaduct nr corby !
# headfforheights @ twitterid
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: saints now need 'a strong character ' following king 's departure , says ian hunter
text: the saints have struggled with consistency of play in their back line for a number of seasons now .
last week 's woeful performance against harlequins looks to of been the final nail in the coffin for alex king at northampton saints .
is it the right decision for king to go ?
yes and no .
yes , because he 's ultimately failed to get the best out of the players he has at his disposal .
and no , because he 's a part of a bigger decision-making team that influences recruitment , player selection and style of plays .
one thing 's for sure .
whoever comes in needs a strong character and total conviction in the way they want to do things .
shrinking violets need not apply .
author: Ian Hunter
Former Northampton Saints and England wing

documents.title: local news site round-up : businesses rates , bomb squad and bike races
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire today :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hastings prepares for 950th anniversary of historic battle
text: thousands of people are expected to descend on east sussex to mark the 950th anniversary of the battle of hastings .
battle abbey , widely accepted as the site of one of the most famous events in british history , is the focus for a weekend of events .
the battle , between william of normandy and anglo-saxon king harold ii , resulted in the english king 's death .

william the conqueror then ordered the construction of rockingham castle near corby , with the castle becoming an important seat of government ; the great council of rockingham being held there in 1095 .

documents.title: surprise and criticism over king leaving saints
text: many in rugby have expressed their surprised at backs coach alex king leaving the saints today .
commentator alastair eykyn wrote on twitter : `` sad news .
great man , outstanding coach .
saints needing a head on a stick for ropy start to the season ?
that 's two very high quality backs coaches out of the door at the gardens in recent years .
not too many smarter than [ paul ] grayson & king . ''
meanwhile , former england fly-half andy goode said king was a `` quality coach ''

there has also been criticism about how northampton saints released the news , with northampton chronicle and echo rugby reporter tom vickers tweeting : `` saints announced news of king 's exit by putting it at bottom of team news article .
hardly a fitting tribute to a man who helped win prem . ''
the times sports writer alex lowe also commented that the news was `` buried ''
northampton saints said king was a `` valued member of the coaching staff '' and that he `` leaves with our thanks and best wishes for the future '' .
saints announced news of king 's exit by putting it at bottom of team news article .
hardly a fitting tribute to a man who helped win prem

documents.title: weather : dry and sunny
text: it will be dry this afternoon with a few sunny spells and a high of 13c ( 55f ) .
there are more details on bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: saints say 'time is right to move on ' as coach king leaves club
text: back coach alex king has left northampton saints with immediate effect `` by mutual consent '' , the club has said .

king , who joined from from clermont auvergne in 2013 , said : `` helping saints win the premiership in 2014 is one of my career highlights , and i wish the club all the success for the coming season . ''
saints ' chief executive allan robson thanked king for his contribution to the team 's successes over the past few years .
`` alex has been a valued member of the coaching staff , '' he said .
`` he played a big role in our premiership and challenge cup titles and finishing top of the table in 2015 .
however , we feel that the time is right to move on . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: coach king leaves northampton saints
text: coach king leaves northampton saints

documents.title: cox keen for your unsung hero nominations # bbcunsunghero
text: rio paralym gold medallist kadeena cox has become the latest sports star to call for your bbc unsung hero nominations .
you 've got just over a week to get your nominations in ( the deadline is sunday , 23 october ) and you can find out how to here .

documents.title: premiership-winning backs coach alex king leaves northampton saints
text: northampton saints have parted company with their backs coach alex king , after four seasons at the gardens .
the former wasps and england fly-half was part of the coaching team that saw them win the european challenge cup and premiership double in the 2013/14 season .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: saints coach alex king sacked
text: saints coach alex king sacked

documents.title: nico hulkenberg : force india driver to join renault for 2017
text: nico hulkenberg is to join renault next season after agreeing a release from his contract with force india .
the german has been chosen to lead renault 's team as they build-up to competitiveness following their return to f1 as a factory entry this year .
silverstone-based force india , for whom hulkenberg has driven for five years , said they `` respected his decision to explore fresh opportunities '' .
team boss vijay mallya said : `` it would be wrong to stand in his way . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: the apprentice : 'loose cannon ' karthik survives lord sugar 's finger
text: despite being left by his team-mates in the boardroom and facing the possibility of being fired , kettering it consultant karthik nagesan made it through to the next stage of the apprentice .
but it was a close one , after lord sugar told him he `` ca n't put up with loose cannons '' following their task to advertise japanese jeans .
while lord sugar has n't quite warmed to karthik 's charms , he 's proving popular with viewers .
beauty salon owner natalie hughes from glasgow was fired .
there is only one karthik ( and one eyebrow ) .

documents.title: if pub becomes a shop it will set a 'terrible precedent ' , says councillor
text: keith holland-delamere ( left ) from the rectory farm residents ' association told me `` there were other options on the table '' for the former barn owl pub , other than turning it into a convenience store .
he said the association had proposed splitting the building `` in two '' , to create a smaller pub and a space for the community .
the ruling conservatives on northampton borough council say they will consider the arguments to keep or remove the covenant at a meeting next week .

however , the borough councillor for the area , james hill ( right ) , a conservative , said if the covenant is overturned it would `` set a terrible precedent throughout the town '' and the issue is `` bigger than the pub in rectory farm '' .
the developer , hawthorn developments , says an existing nearby store has a monopoly which breaches competition law .
it also says it has agreed to `` provide a room within the building for community uses at no charge '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: council could drop covenant on pub for £ 30,000
text: a former pub in the rectory farm area of northampton could be turned into a shop if the borough council decides to drop a covenant , preventing the building from being anything other than a pub .
the council says the covenant on the barn owl is legally enforceable , but the developer says it is n't .
the council is confident it would win if this went to court , but says it ca n't afford to take the risk of losing - which could , potentially , cost it as much as £ 200,000 .
so , it 's decided on a third way .
it says it would be happy to drop the covenant if the developer pays £ 30,000 to the council and agrees to include a room for community use in its plans , but residents are n't happy about it .
the plan will be discussed at a council meeting next wednesday .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: parking charge needed for 'car park maintenance ' and 'security '
text: a spokesman for northampton general hospital says the revenue gained from hospital parking avoids money being taken out of patient care budgets .
he went on to say car park charges help cover the cost of maintenance , cctv and security , and the office where relatives of patients can buy longer-term parking tickets .
research from the press association found northampton general hospital was the sixth most expensive hospital in england for a one-hour stay .

but the hospital spokesman continued : `` our car parking charges are broadly in line with the borough council 's car park costs , in order to discourage shoppers from using spaces at the hospital - which , unlike many hospitals across the country , is on a town centre site . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hospital parking charge one of the highest in england
text: northampton general hospital has one of the most expensive car parking charges in the country , according to research from the press association .
the figures show ngh charges £ 3.10 for a one-hour visit - the sixth-highest charge among nhs trusts in england .
the most expensive trust in the country for a one-hour stay is the royal surrey county hospital in guildford , where patients are forced to pay £ 4 for any stay up to two hours .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: bangladesh v england : weather ruins first day of tourists ' opening warm-up match
text: england 's preparations for the first test against bangladesh were hampered when the opening day of their first tour match was washed out .
play was called off 30 minutes before the start of the two-day game in chittagong , set to begin at 05:00 .
heavy rain this week saturated the outfield at the ma aziz stadium , meaning the england players took part in net practice instead .
the warm-up games represent a chance for 19-year-old haseeb hameed and northants ' opener ben duckett , 21 , to claim a place as captain alastair cook 's opening partner in the tests .
but former england captain michael vaughan says there is a room in the side for both

text: it will be a dry start with some sunny spells , but cloud will thicken through this afternoon , with outbreaks of rain spreading in from the south east towards evening .
feeling cool under the cloud cover with outbreaks of rain affecting mainly eastern parts .

documents.title: royal & derngate gets more than £ 140,000 for diversity funding
text: arts council england is giving £ 144,352 to the royal & derngate and the core at corby cube as part of a country-wide programme aimed at increasing diversity in the arts .
the money will mean andrew miller , currently at the royal welsh college of music & drama , coming to the theatre to work alongside royal & derngate chief executive martin sutherland .
there will also be a `` major event '' aimed at addressing disability issues in the arts .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cloudy
text: most places will be dry , but staying rather cloudy .
there 's the chance of a few isolated showers on the coast and across north norfolk .
turning chilly , with temperatures reaching a low of 6c ( 42f ) .
tomorrow will be a mainly dry but chilly day , with some bright and sunny spells .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: peter bone calls for wellingborough prison to be reopened
text: the government 's coming under fresh pressure to reopen wellingborough prison .
the jail , which housed up to 600 inmates , closed four years ago as part of a reorganisation programme .
the town 's mp peter bone told the commons that the site could still be used .
he has asked the justice secretary liz truss to make a statement to the house about the success of the reorganisation programme , and what is happening to the prison in wellingborough .
author: Paul Rowley
BBC Political Correspondent

documents.title: kettering hospital seeing '20 extra patients every day '
text: kettering general hospital says 90.8 % of a & e patients in september were seen within four hours , up from the 87 % in august from figures published today , but still below the government target of 95 % .
a spokesman for the hospital said : `` we have seen increased use of a & e year-on-year of about 9 % - which equates to about 20 extra patients every day in the a & e department this year .
`` we manage our emergency care system with patient safety as our priority .
we are working closely with our partners to address the issues of flow into and out of the hospital . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pressure on a & e 'all year round ' , says northampton general hospital
text: waiting times in accident and emergency units in england this summer have been worse than every winter for the past 12 years , bar one .
here in the county , northampton general hospital is only seeing 92 % of its patients coming into a & e within four hours .
the government target is 95 % .

a spokeswoman for northampton general hospital said : `` whereas we would usually see a decrease in patient numbers in a & e during the summer months , pressure on emergency departments is now sustained all year round .
`` the four-hour target is affected by two factors - the number of people attending a & e and the pressure on bed space - which means at times we struggle to admit patients onto wards from a & e .
`` at all times , the safety of our patients is our utmost priority . ''
kettering general is also missing the target , with 87 % of patients being seen in that time .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire 'second worst for bed blocking '
text: figures from nhs england show northamptonshire has the second biggest problem with so-called `` bed-blocking '' in the country .
in august , patients spent more than the equivalent of 6,000 days in hospital when they did n't need to be there .
only hampshire had a higher figure .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: wellingborough the least prosperous area of northamptonshire , report says
text: andrew scarborough , who leads the labour opposition on wellingborough council , said the area had been `` left behind '' , after research from the legatum institute said it was the least prosperous area in the county .
however , martin griffith , the conservative leader of the council , says he does not recognise the description , and there are prosperous areas in the borough .
he added there were `` very few empty shops '' in the town centre .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pcc says officer numbers may go down but 'patrol hours ' will go up
text: despite the new police and crime commissioner scrapping the target to have 1,220 police officers , he said he hoped patrol hours would go up `` through the better use of technology '' .
stephen mold also said that he remained `` committed '' to volunteer special police officers , and wanted to provide them with more and better training .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: campbell takes quek back to her roots # getinspired
text: as part of his first get inspired show on radio 5 live , olympic gold medallist darren campbell has taken rio 2016 hockey champion sam quek back to her first premiership hockey club .
sam talks about her journey through hockey , how she nearly turned her back on the game and how she and the team are inspiring the next generation .
you can hear more of the interview with sam - and lots more about getting into sport - from 20:30 bst tonight .

documents.title: local paper round-up : shopfronts and empty buidlings
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire today :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sunshine and showers this afternoon
text: there will be sunny spells this afternoon but the odd shower is also possible , with a high of 12c ( 54f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: whittling down police priorities 'the challenge of being police and crime commissioner '
text: the police and crime commissioner for northamptonshire says having 23 priorities for the police and crime plan is n't too many , and that `` the list of things taken off it was even bigger '' .

stephen mold told me deciding on the priorities for the force was `` the challenge of being police and crime commissioner '' , and while things like hate crime were not on the list of priorities , it would be tackled with `` day-to-day '' policing .
mr mold , who was elected in may , said these priorities represented `` new areas of focus '' .
here are the 23 priorities ( in the vertical columns ) .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: pcc scraps 'arbitrary political target ' of police officer numbers
text: the number of police officers in the county could be cut to fund new cyber-crime investigators .
northamptonshire 's police and crime commissioner is launching a consultation on his new police and crime plan today .
stephen mold is setting out 23 priorities , and says `` difficult decisions '' have to be made .
mr mold says the chief constable should have the power to have more staff dedicated to cyber crime , rather than `` creating some arbitrary political target '' of 1,220 police officers .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: ennis-hill wants you to get active ! jessica ennis-hill retires from athletics
text: british athletics needs a successor to jessica ennis-hill following her retirement from the sport and the lady herself wants to help people be more active and find a way into sport - starting with two fun days combining music and running .
`` for me it 's about communicating my experiences about keeping fit with the general public , '' she says .
`` to help people take those first steps to being more active than they already are and finding a way into sport . ''
find out how anyone can get involved with just about any sport with our special guides .

documents.title: northampton ranks badly for education and safety and security , says research
text: the report from the legatum institute does not make good reading for northampton .
it fares badly in almost all categories , but particularly in safety and security and education :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: corby ranks badly for health , but in top 100 for community spirit
text: in the bottom 50 places for overall prosperity is corby , and you can see that it ranks badly for health and safety and security .
but the report from the legatum institute shows that the town does do better in social capital , which the researchers say is judged on things like community spirit , local initiatives and events .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east northamptonshire most properous area in county , says new research
text: northampton , corby and wellingborough have fared badly in new research looking at overall prosperity .
the report from the legatum institute puts the three towns in the bottom 50 places in the uk .
while the most prosperous area of the county , according to the research , is east northamptonshire
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: district council says it 's 'easy to say no ' to new canal arm
text: the leader of daventry district council said the town council did not `` get the bigger after it objected to the proposed new canal arm for daventry , at the sight
the district council says the new canal arm , and proposed boat lift , would make daventry a `` destination '' .
leader chris miller said it was `` easy to say no '' , but the district council was `` trying to make daventry better '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: daventry town council objects to district council 's canal plans
text: town councillors in daventry say they wo n't support plans for a new canal in the town .

the district council wants to extend the grand union to the edge of the town centre to create a tourist attraction and boost the economy , but the town council voted last night to lodge formal objection to the scheme .
town councillor maureen luke said : `` there are other ways to spend £ 10m .
daventry needs a lot of improvement , but the canal arm wo n't do it for us . ''
the council also queried whether it would the taxpayer or the canal and rivers trust who would maintain the new proposed arm of the canal .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: film northants closes after eight years
text: film northants , which has showcased locally-made short films for the past eight years , is to close .
the organisation says it has n't been able to attract enough people to help run it .
lily canter , who is the chair of film northants , said it had been `` eight great years '' and last year 's two-day festival at the errol flynn filmhouse meant it `` went out on a high '' .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: paul o'connell tips dylan hartley as british and irish lions captain
text: england captain dylan hartley would be a great leader for next summer 's tour to new zealand , says former british and irish lions captain paul o'connell .
hartley has been banned for a total of 54 weeks in his career for incidents including gouging , biting and punching .
but ireland legend o'connell says the northampton saints hooker can cope with leading the side in the country of his birth .
author: Tom English
BBC Sport

documents.title: duckett helps england to series win in bangladesh
text: england won the one-day series against bangladesh with a four-wicket victory in a tense deciding match in chittagong yesterday .
playing in only his third one-day international , northants opener ben duckett was england 's top scorer with 63 , his second half-century of the series .
england coach trevor bayliss described 21-year-old duckett as `` a power player '' while former england captain nasser hussain said he was `` the iceman , cool , calm , tough '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy with some rain
text: it 'll be sometimes cloudy with scattered showers , mainly this morning , then becoming drier and brighter in the afternoon .
the easterly wind will give a very cool feel to the day .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire .
between now and 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
we 'll be looking at the prosperity of northamptonshire and what the police and crime commissioner thinks should be the priorities for the county .
but after the weather we 'll look at a couple of local sportsmen making an impact on the world stage .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: thanks for reading today .
tomorrow we 'll look at how 10-year-old children in northamptonshire could be risking serious eye conditions because they 're not taking eye exams .
in the meantime , enjoy bake off tonight , and see you again at 08:00 tomorrow .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight with showers by the morning
text: it will remain rather cloudy , with showers developing by the early hours of the morning , bringing a wet start to thursday .
lows of 5c ( 41f ) .
the rest of tomorrow will be mostly dry , with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
weather has more details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: saints face a stern test this weekend
text: northampton saints will welcome montpellier to franklin 's gardens this weekend for the opening fixture of this season 's european rugby champions ' cup .
it 's been a difficult start to the season for saints .
two wins from six games in the premiership is far from ideal , and a montpellier team stacked with internationals like bismarck du plessis will give them a tough match .
plus , if you 're in any doubt about what the competition means to the french side , read this from their coach , jake white .
hear how saints feel ahead of the match with stephen myler on the saints show , tonight on bbc radio northampton from 18:00 .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton shopmobility closure : 'we fully understand the impact this is going to have '
text: we 've been hearing more on why northampton shopmobility , which hires out mobility aids like scooters , is having to close .
the scheme says hires of its equipment have dropped significantly recently , although it 's not clear why .
another big part of the though is the reduction in grants from northampton borough council over recent years .

sam towell , chairman of trustees of the northampton door-to-doorservice , said `` we would like to thank our loyal and dedicated team of volunteers and staff who have managed the scheme over the many years it has operated in the town centre .

`` we find it very sad and disappointing that we have been unable to save the scheme and fully understand the impact this is going to have on all of the users who will no longer be able to access the town centre and go to northampton general hospital for outpatient appointments . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: duckett out for 63
text: northamptonshire 's young star , ben duckett , is out for 63 in england 's third one-day international against bangladesh , in chittagong .
it took a moment of brilliance from mushfiqur though , pulling off a spectacular catch down the leg-side .
it 's a much improved performance from duckett , who was out for a duck in the previous match .
england are chasing 278 for victory .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton shopmobility to close
text: northampton shopmobility is well-loved .
it 's a lifeline for its users .
it will also close , for good , on saturday , 29 october .
shopmobility is a nationwide scheme that lends manual and powered wheelchairs and scooters to people with limited mobility , thus allowing them to shop and visit facilities in a town or city .
in northampton it operates out of mayorhold car park .
its closure will be deeply unpopular with the people who rely on it .
mobility scooters are n't cheap and the nominal charge to hire one gave independence to people who 'd otherwise be unable to get around on their own .
shopmobility costs £ 40,000-a-year to run - and as its grants have been hacked away , it 's no longer able to cover its costs .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: £ 1.3m grant to create new centre for students at university of northampton
text: at the moment it 's a graffiti-covered , derelict , engine shed on the junction of the london and northwestern railway and northampton branch line .
thanks to a grant of £ 1.3m from the heritage lottery fund though , it 'll be transformed into a new students ' union building for the university of northampton .
the site was unused for years , but as the building takes shape for the university 's new waterside campus , the shed will be part of it - giving the 1873 structure a new lease of life .
the new campus is due to open in 2018 .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: charity bike ride from northampton to ypres raises £ 25k
text: riding a bike from northampton to a first world war battlefield is no mean feat , but the ride for hope 2016 did exactly that last month , raising £ 25,000 for northampton hope centre in the process .
the centre works to tackle the causes of homelessness and helps people get back on their own feet .
here 's an idea of how the riders got on - including some spectacular scenery
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: pm promises more money for kettering nhs
text: kettering mp philip hollobone has been on his feet at prime minister 's questions , raising the issue of what he sees as under-funding of the nhs in the town .
mr hollobone said the population of kettering had been growing rapidly , but that `` due to a historic anomaly '' the nhs in the area was `` amongst the most under-funded in the whole country '' .
theresa may responded by saying consistent high-quality care is important and the funding for the nhs clinical commissioning group was being `` corrected '' for this year , to rectify the anomaly .
mrs may said £ 757m will be invested in his `` local area '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'yobs on motorcycles ' take over bridleway
text: the sums it up , really .
people living between hunsbury hill and sixfields in northampton say the bridleway to the rear of their homes is a no-go area , because of people riding motorbikes up and down it .
the noise is bad enough , but mums wo n't walk their children to school down it any more and other people say it 's too dangerous to use .
peter minney is partially sighted : `` i do n't come down here when it gets dark .
for the likes of me , with my guide dog , it 's made awkward .
it 's a lovely walk - people should be able to enjoy it . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton borough council latest to consider cuts to council tax benefit
text: some of the poorest and most vulnerable people in northampton could be told to pay more council tax from april next year .
northampton borough council wants your views on whether to cut the council tax benefit it gives to people on low incomes , including disabled people .
when kettering borough council made similar proposals last month , recipients warned it could push them over the edge financially .
but councils say the cost of council tax benefit is being passed to them from central government , forcing them to take tough decisions .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: it 's not you sorry !
text: a sigh of relief for one ticket holder - and a collective groan from the rest of us .
a prize of £ 67,440.20 , won on a euromillions ticket bought in the corby and kettering area back in april , has been claimed .
the ticket was due to expire on 19 october , so the anonymous winner will be breathing a sigh of relief .
i do wonder where on earth the ticket was being kept though !
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hs2 needed 'more now than ever before '
text: transport secretary chris grayling has been reiterating the government 's backing for the controversial high speed 2 rail-link between london and the north of england .
at an hs2 conference in london he said `` we need hs2 now more than ever '' , despite concerns over damage to the environment and its multibillion-pound cost .

his comments follow confirmation he plans to make £ 70m of government funds available to support local communities affected by the line and to improve road safety along the route , which will run through parts of buckinghamshire and northamptonshire .
the first phase of the railway - between london and birmingham - should be finished by 2026 .
`` we 're facing a rapidly approaching crunch-point , '' said mr grayling .
`` in the last 20 years alone , the number of people travelling on our railways has more than doubled and our rail network is the most intensively used of any in europe .
`` we need hs2 for the capacity it will bring on the routes between london , the west midlands , crewe , leeds and manchester , as well as the space it 'll create elsewhere on our transport network .
`` we need it for the boost it will give to our regional and national economies , '' he added .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: government announces £ 70m funding for hs2 communities
text: the government has announced £ 70m-worth of funding for local communities and road safety along the route of the hs2 rail link .
the high-speed route will go through parts of buckinghamshire and northamptonshire .
out of this money , £ 40m is for things like improving community facilities , protecting the environment and access to the countryside .
it will also support the economy in areas where business will be disrupted by construction of the link .
community groups and charities will be able to bid for that cash from next year .
another £ 30m is being set aside for road safety - things like safer junctions and pedestrian crossings .
transport secretary chris grayling has been reiterating the government 's backing for the rail link between london and the north of england at conference in london .
he said : `` we need hs2 now more than ever . ''
author: Elly Zaniewicka
BBC News

documents.title: it 's a dog 's life in pattishall
text: weather watcher `` paulamaria '' snapped this scene this morning , in pretty pattishall .
we assume it 's her dog enjoying the crisp , bright morning .
places like pattishall will get the best of any sunny spells this afternoon , but for most it 'll be cloudy and chilly .
13c ( 55f ) the high .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: could the 'road to nowhere ' become the road to somewhere ?
text: it 's a road to nowhere - and you ca n't `` come on inside '' , because it 's fenced off .
this stretch of road , a spur off the a4500 west of northampton , could soon have an actual purpose , thanks to development first proposed 10 years ago .
upton lodge would be the latest housing development built on the corridor between duston and junction 16 of the m1 .
about 1,400 homes , a primary school and local services could be built here .
the first public consultation event is due to take place tomorrow .
it means that perhaps the most pointless stretch of road in northamptonshire could actually get a purpose .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fancy a chat and run ?
text: in the week of world mental health day , england athletics and the charity mind are encouraging people to # runandtalk to improve their mental wellbeing .
people are being urged to run one mile or further and to chat with friends , family , colleagues or other runners .
find out more about the event and how you can get involved here .
you can find out more about getting into running with our special guide .

documents.title: daventry express : retail and leisure plans for town
text: meanwhile in daventry , a new food store , retail units , family restaurant and more could be built in the town - and today you can see what they 'll look like .
the snappily-titled `` town centre vision 5 '' is on display at daventry library , on north street , from 10:30 to 16:00 today and friday , the daventry express reports .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: should daventry have a canal ?
text: it 's a simple question - and it 's been rumbling around for years .
supporters say building a new arm from the grand union canal into daventry will bring in tourists .
one idea has been to build a boat lift , akin to the falkirk wheel .
critics say spending £ 18m on the spur is ridiculous and that re-opening the outdoor pool , or tidying up the town , is a better idea .
a planning application is in for the canal arm - tonight daventry town council will give its response .
it wo n't make the final decision , but its view will be quite influential .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: charity 'brought me an escape '
text: wellingborough charity home start , which supports vulnerable young families in the borough , says it could close unless it 's able to raise new funding .
it 's asking for 2,000 people to each give £ 3 a month , making a total of £ 72,000 a year .
linda chatterton was helped by home start 20 years ago and now supports other people at the charity .
`` i was suffering with post-natal depression .
home start brought me a volunteer and brought me an escape , really , from my home , '' she said .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: vulnerable parents could be left without support if home start closes
text: vulnerable new parents in wellingborough could be left without support according to home start , which fears it could close unless it can secure future funding .
the charity offers help to young families with issues like post-natal depression .
the big lottery has been funding a project at home start for several years , but that project is finishing soon and the charity now has to plug the gap .
`` my fear is that people will just fall between the cracks because there are n't any other services that can up the pieces , '' said the organisation 's fundraiser , susan thompson .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'motorbike nuisance has always been a problem '
text: northamptonshire police says it is taking the problem of nuisance motorbike riding seriously , wherever it occurs , in operation neutrino .
`` motorbike nuisance has always been around , '' said pcso sean whelan .
`` it 's always been a problem , a concern , for members of the public .
from noise issues to antisocial riding , people pulling wheelies .
`` this new operation has been quite effective at giving a voice to members of the public and enabling us to effectively combat the issue . ''
you can report antisocial motorbike use by emailing operationneutrino @ northants.pnn.police.uk
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'he came up and said he 'd wrap my camera around my head '
text: whether it 's kingsley , hunsbury , eastfield , king 's heath or another part of northampton , lots of you have been telling bbc radio northampton that `` it 's only a matter of time '' before someone 's seriously hurt by an irresponsible motorcyclist .
`` not all of them are aggressive , but some of them are , '' said vic smith , from the friends of eastfield park .
`` this incident of actually driving at people , driving at dogs , has been increasing .
i was trying to take a photograph of one of them and he came up and said he 'd wrap his camera around my head . ''
northamptonshire police 's operation neutrino is trying to tackle the problem .
the force has crushed bikes used irresponsibly and illegally in the past , but vic says more should be done to publicise its work .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: police launch crackdown on nuisance motorcyclists
text: police in northampton say they are already seeing results from a new scheme tackling illegal off-road motorcyclists .
it follows complaints from areas including kingsley and hunsbury where residents say it 's `` only a matter of time '' before someone is seriously hurt .
the new system allows people to provide evidence to a dedicated police email address .

pcso sean whelan said : `` we had a case where someone was pulling a wheelie and accelerating at high speeds in the kingsley area by the racecourse a member of the public was able to contact us directly through the email address .
`` they provided a photo , a cctv image , and a registration , officers traced down the rider of the bike and he was issued a section 59 notice . ''
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : mostly dry with the odd shower
text: after a bright start for many , it will be a mostly dry day , although rather chilly .
there may be the odd shower at times , especially in the east , with temperatures reaching around 15c ( 59f ) .
here 's my full regional forecast
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live news , sport , weather , travel and more .

today we 'll be looking at a new scheme to crack down on illegal off-road motorcyclists and the news that vulnerable new parents in wellingborough could be left without support if home start has to close .
but first , a full weather forecast for the area .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the day 's news , travel , weather and sport updates .
but of course , any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
we 'll leave you with this of the formula 1 constructors ' champions mercedes and the celebrations at their base in brackley .
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: boothroyd 's england under-21s thrash bosnia-herzegovina
text: england under-21s finished their european championship qualifying campaign in style by thrashing bosnia-herzegovina in walsall .
the under-21s were led by aidy boothroyd after coach gareth southgate stepped up to take interim charge of the senior side .

former peterborough player and coach , and watford and northampton town manager boothroyd , had already seen england seal their place at next summer 's finals , but has now won his two games in charge .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : chilly night and showers tomorrow
text: a mostly fine and dry end to the day with some isolated showers .
overnight a mixture of cloud and clear spells .
potentially getting quite chilly where the skies stay clear with lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
a chilly start to the day tomorrow followed by sunny spells and scattered showers and highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: year groups in wellingborough and kettering have more pupils than places
text: figures from the county council show that in certain areas there are more children than places for them ,
the government recommends that at least 5 % of school places should remain vacant but in northampton , corby , kettering , and wellingborough that 's not the case .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: celebrations in northamptonshire for mercedes constructors ' championship win
text: with nico rosberg winning the japanese grand prix and lewis hamilton finishing third , mercedes secured the world constructors ' championship .
today rosberg , hamilton and mercedes boss toto wolff have visited the factory in brixworth and the team base in brackley .
and now complete with the # f1 trophy your silver arrows stars are home !
# thetriple
oh hi @ twitterid lurking on the stairs @ twitterid @ twitterid hq !
welcome home all .
congratulations # thetriple # bestteam
pretty spectacular what you have achieved .
congrats

documents.title: pressure on schools 'absolutely huge '
text: northamptonshire county councillor matt golby said pressure on the school system in the county `` is absolutely huge '' .
he also said that the council knew that `` demand is going to continue '' .
figures from the authority show the number of school places have increased since 2010
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire cyclist hannah barnes gets top-15 finish
text: towcester 's hannah barnes has finished 14th in the women 's individual time trial at the road world championships in doha , qatar .
it 's a very good result for the 23-year-old , and bodes well for the women 's road race at the weekend .
the usa 's amber neben won the race .
author: Simon Brotherton
Cycling commentator

documents.title: mps and county council meet minister to talk about northamptonshire schools
text: the mps for wellingborough , kettering and corby - peter bone , philip hollobone and tom pursglove - along with county councillor matt golby have met minister of state for school standards nick gibb to discuss education in northamptonshire .
it comes as schools in some parts of the county are still facing problems with overcrowding , according to figures from the county council .
at the department for education with @ twitterid @ twitterid and philip hollobone mp discussing education in northamptonshire .
whats your view on grammar school mr bone ?
previously lived in bucks which has system not impressed .
if you fail 11+ you 're left out to dry !
i wish my grandchildren had the same educational opportunities as i had .
can you ring me about this please peter ?
i 'm at bbc northampton .

documents.title: luton man dies in m1 collision
text: a man from luton has died in a collision on the m1 in northamptonshire .
the collision , involving a lorry and a construction worker , happened at about 09:00 yesterday within a section of road works on the northbound carriageway , just north of junction 16 .
the 47-year-old construction worker died at the scene .
northamptonshire police is appealing for information .

documents.title: your sunrise over northampton
text: we just wanted to share these stunning of the sunrise this morning over northamptonshire from a couple of bbc weather watchers
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: local paper round-up : daventry plans , more houses for corby , and life-saving drugs
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: case dropped against 'pig of marseille '
text: case dropped against 'pig of marseille '

documents.title: weather : mostly dry today , with the odd shower
text: it will be a another settled day for all of us with just the odd shower possible at times .
these will most likely be in the east of the county , but may move across to the west through the afternoon with a top temperature of 14c ( 57f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cosgrove hall fire not being treated as sus
text: northamptonshire police have told me that they are not involved in the investigation into friday 's fire at cosgrove hall at the current time , which means it is not being treated as sus
however , five days on from the blaze that gutted the grade ii-listed 18th century house , the fire service has yet to establish what the actual cause was , and investigations are continuing .
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: cobblers wo n't appeal matt taylor red card
text: northampton town have confirmed that they will not be appealing the red card given to midfielder matt taylor in their 1-1 draw at league one leaders scunthorpe on saturday .

taylor will now be banned for three matches , including the derby against peterborough , but cobblers manager rob page said he thought the dismissal was `` harsh '' but added : `` we 've looked at it and we 've decided not to appeal . ''
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: royal and derngate play about shakespeare 's daughter wins theatre award
text: a play co-produced by the royal and derngate in northampton has won a prestigious award .
`` the herbal bed '' , about the secret life of william shakespeare 's daughter was named best touring production at the uk theatre awards ceremony at london 's guildhall .

the play , a co-production with english touring theatre and the rose theatre , kingston , was directed by the royal and derngate 's artistic director james dacre and opened in northampton in february before starting a national tour .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hannah barnes on the road in world championships
text: northamptonshire 's hannah barnes is competing the individual time trial at the road world championships in doha , qatar .
the 23-year-old from towcester is hoping to follow up the silver she won on sunday in the team time trial with the professional canyon-sram squad .
you can watch the action on the bbc sport website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: james shayler told newspaper he would team up with russian extremists at euros
text: the case against football thug james shayler had originally been brought by police and the crown prosecution service in response to alleged comments he made in a sunday star newspaper article .
mr shayler , 50 , from wellingborough , had suggested he intended to join up with russian supporters at euro 2016 to attack muslims .
his passport had been confiscated as part of proceedings at northampton magistrates ' court in june , while bail conditions stipulated he could n't leave england or wales before his next hearing .
the case had been adjourned until july 11 - the day the tournament finished - but was then put back again until today .
the bbc learned it was dropped on october 6 - with the competition long finished .
the england vs russia game , which mr shayler had said he wanted to attend , was marred by clashes between supporters ( above ) .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: case to ban hooligan from euro 2016 discontinued - three months after tournament ends
text: a notorious football hooligan who had been due to appear in court today to face a banning order has seen his case discontinued .

james shayler , known as the `` pig of marseille ' for his part in violence in the french city during the 1998 world cup ( above ) , had his passport confiscated , preventing him from travelling to france for england 's opening game of euro 2016 .
but a formal hearing was adjourned and , considering the tournament finished in july , it is perhaps no surprise the case against the 50-year-old from wellingborough was dropped on october 6 .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: new desborough politcal party wants to replace all town councillors
text: the new independents for desborough political party has said that its ultimate aim is to replace all 12 people currently on the town council , but that any number of councillors at the election in two years ' time `` would be fantastic '' .

kevin o'brien , one of the party 's founders and a leading voice of discontent over the current town council described independents for desborough as a `` minor political party '' , saying it was `` only interested in desborough '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a chilly start to the day
text: was it the coldest morning of the autumn ?
e anglia cold start : -0.1c s'n downham 0.9c woburn 1.4c marham 1.7c cambridge 2.1c cavendish 2.4c houghton hall 3.0c writtle 3.3c wattisham
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: desborough gets new political party
text: a new political party has been set up in desborough .
it follows objections to a 400 % increase in the town council 's proportion of the council tax , and a no-confidence vote in the council .
`` independents for desborough '' plans to put up candidates at future elections promising to `` listen to the public '' before making decisions .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: on this day : last game for cobblers at the county ground in 1994
text: good morning .
22 years ago today we played our final game at the county ground , a 1-0 defeat to mansfield town
i preferred the first last game that we won 22 years though , how # proudtobe

documents.title: boothroyd takes charge of england u21s in final euro qualifer
text: england 's u21s play their final euro 2017 qualifier today when they host bosnia and herzegovina in walsall .
it will be the second game in charge of the team for the u20s coach aidy boothroyd , who took charge when gareth southgate stepped up to the england senior side following sam allardyce 's exit .
the former peterborough player and coach won his first game in charge 1-0 in kazakhstan , securing qualification for euro 2017 in poland in june .
whether boothroyd , a former watford and northampton manager , will be leading the side then will depend on how southgate fares in charge of england who take on slovenia tonight .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: kettering complex allow budding retailers to 'try it ' without giving their day job
text: michaela jones , who offers help and advice to the retailers at the yards , says that budding business people can just `` try it but do n't need to have a full commitment '' , selling their products sometimes just once a week .
she said there was help available with tills and advertising , allowing them to maintain another job , or spend time with their families .
however , ms jones explained that the advantage they had is that if they wanted to do more , they could , and could move to a bigger premises .
even though the centre has only been open a year , businesses which started operating from just one day a week , now operate full-time in bigger shops elsewhere in kettering .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering 's 'mini-camden ' celebrates first birthday
text: the yards in kettering is celebrating the first anniversary of its opening this week .
the former industrial site in the town centre is home to 46 shops and stalls .
the developers say it 's an incubator site encouraging small retailers to establish themselves before moving into the high street .
those i 've been speaking to who work there and visit it describe it as a `` mini-camden '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: brexit vote a 'massive boost ' for exporters , says kettering 's mp
text: the government is resisting calls to give mps a vote on the terms of any deal to leave the european union .

the brexit secretary david davis told the commons there 'll be `` full parliamentary scrutiny '' in the run-up to britain 's withdrawal but insisted he wo n't let critics `` undo '' the referendum result .
he was supported by the conservative mp for kettering philip hollobone , who supported the leave campaign , and argued that the economic signs since the referendum have been good .
the depreciation in sterling since june 23 has given a massive boost to britain 's international competitiveness and has been great news for britain 's exporters .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and scattered showers
text: a cold start to the day , with patchy fog clearing slowly .
there 'll be sunny spells , with scattered showers pushing inland from the north sea and the easterly breeze will keep it chilly along the coast with temperatures reaching a peak of 15c ( 59f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
bit of a `` brrr , it 's cold '' start today .
we 'll have the weather shortly , plus all the travel , news and sport .
we 'll also be taking a look at the continuing need for school places in the county .
if you want to get in touch then please email me or tweet us .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: our live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
but we 'll leave you with this double rainbow taken not too long ago in daventry marvellous .

documents.title: weather : chilly tonight , chance of showers tomorrow
text: showers will gradually become confined mostly to coastal districts overnight , with many inland areas becoming dry with clear spells .
temperatures will fall to 2c ( 36f ) .
mist patches will clear tomorrow morning to leave some sunny spells , especially at first , but cloud and occasional showers will tend to feed inland , most frequent near the coast .
it will feel cool in the noticeable north-easterly breeze , with temperatures peaking at 16c ( 61f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: victims of bedfordshire abuse plan to sue
text: details of systematic child abuse that went on at a home for boys in shefford have been revealed for the first time today , despite three previous failed police investigations .
most of the perpetrators are dead or too old to prosecute for the crimes , which took place in the 1960s and '70s .
the old bailey heard victims as young as eight were abused at st francis boys ' home , run by `` nuns and priests from hell '' .
two of the worst offenders , father john ryan who ran the home and father wilfred johnson , died before this latest investigation .
the wider investigation covered :
the seven men and six women police identified as suspects , who are now deceased , held varying roles in the home , including a teacher , choirmaster and handyman .
these offences date back until the 1940s and the victims have had to deal with what happened to them for many years . ''
james mccann , 80 , of swaffham ( above ) , was ruled unfit to stand trial for his many crimes .
only john cahill ( below ) , a scoutmaster at the northampton catholic diocese-run home , has been jailed - for three and a half years in may .
the victims will try to bring civil action against st francis children 's society which ran the home .
the victims ' lawyer , tracey emmott , said it 's due in part to the `` savile effect '' that they were finally taken seriously .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal & derngate : a look at the plans
text: the plans announced by the royal and derngate are ambitious , there is no doubt about that , but with all three schemes there is definitely a need to be fulfilled .

we have seen many stories about the need for more school places in the county , so any plans for a new school will be welcomed and indeed heather smith , leader of the county council , has already made positive noises about the idea .
the theatre has pointed out this would n't be a theatre school , but reflect a wider curriculum , and is asking people to offer their opinions on the plans .
as long ago as 2004 , i looked at why daventry did n't have a cinema , and certainly residents will be looking forward to not having to travel to rugby or northampton to see the latest releases .
one of the reasons for the success of the errol flynn filmhouse is because of it 's relative small size , especially compared to northampton 's two multiplexes .
but with no competitors in daventry , the proposed cinema could be bigger , with more screens and seats , than the errol flynn filmhouse .
finally , the idea of a 'portable ' musical theatre venue shows the increase in collaborative working between arts organisations .

there is less money for the arts , and so groups are looking to work together , but also attempt to keep making the kind of distinctive original work , which the royal and derngate has in recent years become known for .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal & derngate : new 'portable ' musical theatre for festivals
text: the third announcement made by the royal & dernagte yesterday was by their artistic director james dacre .
he said that , along with a partners including scottish opera , the theatre will commission , develop and support a new music theatre .
he said he wanted to build the royal theatre 's early history as an opera house .
their productions will be presented over the coming years in a festival format , in northampton and at major uk and international festivals .
as part of this a portable theatre venue called the mix is being built , which will have flexible auditorium seating for between 200 and 400 people .
james dacre said they they want to make new music theatre which was `` audience-friendly , locally relevant , collaborative and deeply imaginative '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal & derngate : daventry could see a new cinema in town centre
text: alongside the announced of a plan for a school , theroyal & derngate also revealed it is working with daventry district council to build a cinema in the proposed redevelopment of daventry town centre .

the theatre already runs the errol flynn filmhouse cinema , based at their theatre in northampton , where work has start on a second screen , and also shows films at the core theatre in corby , which it runs .
councillor colin poole , from daventry district council , said the talks were at an `` early stage '' but were `` encouraging '' .
building work has already begun on a multiplex cinema at the rushden lakes development and there plans for an eight-screen cinema on the site of of the former greyfriars bus station in northampton .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal & derngate : plan for theatre to sponsor secondary school
text: northampton could be the site of the first secondary school in the country to be sponsored by a theatre .
at an event yesterday , the chief executive of the royal and derngate , martin sutherland , announced plans to set up a school specialising in the arts .

mr sutherland told me : `` there are theatres all over the country doing the most brilliant education and youth theatre work , as we do , and working in schools , as we do , but we this is the first theatre to say , 'there is a government structure , let 's see if it 's viable ' . ''

he was keen to point it that it would not be a stage school , but a regular secondary school , with an arts specialism , comparing it to the school which premiership rugby club saracens plan for london .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: richard coles interviews interrupted by people needing the loo
text: finedon vicar and broadcaster rev richard coles has been at the bbc in salford doing interviews about his new book .
but it seems the radio booth looks rather like well
in the radio booth at bbc salford interrupted now and then by members of the public who mistake it for a lavatory .
to be fair , it looks like it has the potential to be a tremendously comfy cludgie .
bit of a signage problem by the look of it .
sometimes people just take the piss
the glamour
smidge of irony in there ?
likewise a similar brief encounter experienced on a train at the weekend
does it have a public gallery reverend ?
'bog echo ' being a useful echo chamber back in the day .
or a futuristic confessional when they find you inside
easy mistake by the look of it !
a penny for your thoughts .
commode ?
a very chic lavatory .
i 'm not surprised !
not surprising
hope they do n't unzip as soon as the doors open
obviously , number one for service then !
one hopes they realise their mistake before it is too late

documents.title: crick athletic colts ladies football team finding their feet
text: after a difficult start to life in northamptonshire women 's and girl 's football league division one , including a 34-0 loss to corby town ladies , crick athletic colts ladies are starting to find their feet .
we went along to see the football team in action .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: abusive housemaster wo n't face jail
text: the 80-year-old housemaster found to have abused 25 boys in his care wo n't face prison .
james mccann of suffield court , swaffham , beat boys at st francis boys ' home with a belt or stick and punched one of them with full force in the face , the old bailey heard .
the jury was told he also forced youngsters as young as eight to engage in indecent acts for his own sexual gratification in a wash room , a bath and in bed .

however , as mccann , 80 , suffers from dementia and has had a number of strokes , he was deemed unfit to stand trial and jurors were told only to decide on the facts of the case rather than his guilt .
judge rebecca poulet told jurors the only course of action in the circumstances was an absolute discharge .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: full extent of abuse at catholic orphanage can now be revealed
text: an 80-year-old housemaster who worked at st francis boys ' home in shefford , bedfordshire , in the 1960s and '70s has been found to have been part of a sadistic and vindictive regime of abuse , involving priests and a paedophile scoutmaster .
james mccann ( of suffield court in swaffham , faced 50 charges relating to an 11-year period from 1963 .
the case is unusual because the judge ruled mccann was not fit to stand trial , so a trial of the facts alone was held at the old bailey .
jurors decided he was responsible for 30 physical attacks and 12 indecent acts on the boys , who are now aged in their 50s and 60s .

it can now be reported that john cahill , 74 , of chandos court , bedford , an ex-scoutmaster at the northampton catholic diocese-run home ( below ) , was jailed for three-and-a-half years in may this year .
he abused boys aged between 10 and 15 in the 1960s .
the two main priests facing abuse charges , fr john ryan and fr wilfred johnson , died before the present police investigation started .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakinghousemaster found to have abused boys at a catholic orphanage
text: an 80-year-old former housemaster at st francis boys ' home in shefford , bedfordshire , has been found to have abused 25 victims .
james mccann , from swaffham , norfolk , was found unfit to plea at the old bailey , but a trial of the facts found in his victims ' favour .
he faced 50 charges in total , ranging from actual bodily harm to indecency with a child , over offences at the home run by the northampton diocese of the catholic church .
forty two counts were proven , eight were not proven .
at least one count was proven on all 25 victims .
more to follow .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cosgrove hall fire : investigations ongoing
text: northamptonshire fire and rescue says investigations are ongoing at cosgrove hall in south northamptonshire , where a fire gutted the grade ii-listed 18th century house .
it says it 's too early to determine the cause of the fire , and could n't confirm newspaper reports that artwork by sir joshua reynolds was destroyed in the fire .
over the weekend these shots of the blaze , from a hot air balloon , were sent to us
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: strictly come dancing : lesley joseph quicksteps through to next week
text: it was movie week on strictly and northampton actress lesley joseph performed a quickstep to `` a couple of swells '' by judy garland , with professional partner anton du beke
lesley scored 27 points , level with anastacia and judge rinder , but above the bottom two of naga and ed .
then thanks to the combined score of the judges and the voting public , lesley avoided the `` dance-off '' and will be back next week .
eastenders actress tameka empson was eliminated .

documents.title: strictly come dancing : who made it through
text: we are about to reveal who made it through on strictly come dancing , so if you do n't want to know then look away now .
author: BBC One

documents.title: world conker championship : in
text: yesterday saw the world conker championships in southwick with a wide variety of competitors
there was a team from the usa ( below ) - ( l-r ) alex egan , tyler knepper , jaclyn chateau , dyan jones and carlton shkabaka .
slightly closer to home , these chaps ( below ) from sutton coldfield also got into the spirit of things ( l-r ) paul meadows , steve kesterton , chris hipkiss and scott hayley .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: world conker championship : earls barton man crowned new champion
text: a new king has been crowned world conker champion after taking part in the annual games on the northamptonshire-cambridgeshire border for the first time .
tom dryden , from earls barton , described the news as `` absolutely outstanding '' .
lorna clarke , from oxford , took the the women 's title .
it 's the second time she had entered the games .
organisers said 190 competitors from countries including russia , the usa and japan took part in the event in southwick , near oundle , yesterday .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: former england captain jeeps dies at 84
text: former england captain jeeps dies at 84

documents.title: saints , england and british lions legend dickie jeeps dies aged 84
text: tributes have been paid to one of the greatest names in the history of northampton saints rugby club .
dickie jeeps died at the weekend aged 84 .
starting his career at cambridge in 1949 , he played for saints , england and the british lions in the 1950s and '60s .
the scrum-half also captained england and lions .
after he finished playing he went on to become president of the rugby football union in 1976-77 and chairman of the sports council for seven years .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: f1 : lewis hamilton says he 'll give title race everything
text: lewis hamilton says he will give the remaining four races `` everything i 've got '' after a major blow to his title chances at the japanese grand prix .
hamilton , from stevenage , finished third as brackley-based mercedes team-mate nico rosberg won .
he 's now 33 points behind the german , with a maximum of 100 still available .
the world champion said : `` that 's a healthy margin for nico .
he did a great job so congratulations to him .
`` it is going very well for him .
i just have to try to do the best job i can . ''
rosberg 's ninth victory of the season means he can now afford to finish second behind hamilton in all the remaining races and still win the championship .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer at Suzuka

documents.title: weather : sunny start , but chance of hail and thunder later
text: there 'll be some sunny intervals throughout today , but showers will move in from the east and they could be heavy at times .
a chance of hail and thunder too .
top temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
here 's my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire
text: hello again , it 's the start of another week .
between now and 18:00 we 'll bring you all the news you need for northamptonshire .
we 'll also bring you a round-up of all the weekend 's sport .
plus , in a moment - the all important weather .
